snippet: A series of attacks targeting Shiite Muslims in Baghdad and southern Iraq left at least 90 people dead and more than 260 wounded, according to security officials.
abstract: Series of explosions in Iraq that mostly targeted Shiite Muslims amount to an emphatic demonstration of the still-potent capabilities of the Sunni insurgency and a reminder of the instability left behind by American forces; officials say more than 90 people are dead and at least 260 wounded on day that is the deadliest since the American withdrawal.

byline.contributor: Zaid Thaker, Duraid Adnan and Yasir Ghazi contributed reporting. Employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from Baghdad, Hilla, Mosul, Kirkuk, Samarra, Falluja and Ramadi.

lead_paragraph: A series of attacks targeting Shiite Muslims in Baghdad and southern Iraq left at least 90 people dead and more than 260 wounded, according to security officials.

headline.seo: Attacks in Iraq Target Shiite Muslims
headline.main: Bomb Attacks Around Iraq Target Shiites, Killing Dozens
headline.print_headline: Bomb Attacks Around Iraq Target Shiites, Killing Dozens
